intro: Vvedenskya pinnatifolia, commonly known as the red-flowered vvedenskya, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces striking red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. Vvedenskya pinnatifolia is adapted to grow in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
